column4: Guys when i type "linux /boot/vmlinux-2.6.31.20-generic" it loads fine.. I get [Linux-bzImage, setup=0x3400, size.......etc.. Now when i type "boot" it tries to boot but i get a Kernel panic because it can't find my standard ext3 filesystem as this is a Wubi installation.. Help please?
Maybe you have touched your root partition (where OS is located)

yes my Wubi setup loads my root windows parition, but inside that you have a VFS whcih is my ubuntu, it doesn'ty find this by default it has to be specified somehow to loads from the VFS within my standard partition :( :( (:
